isis.stitle: 2 SPEED AND DOUBLE REDUCTION SINGLE DRIVE AXLES: EATON - REMOVE - WHEEL DIFFERENTIAL ( Figure 15 )

figure.caption: Figure 15. Wheel Differential Assembly - Exploded View

step1.para: Remove nuts and bolts fastening ring gear and support cases.
Remove small support case and thrust washer ( Figure 16).

figure.caption: Figure 16. Small Support Case & Thrust Washer

note.para: A soft-faced hammer or mallet may be required to dislodge gear from its mounting.

step1.para: To remove differential assembly, position support case assembly on its side, then slowly roll the case and slide differential assembly out of the case.
Remove thrust washer from large support case ( Figure 17).

figure.caption: Figure 17. Thrust Washer Removal from Large Support Case

step1.para: Invert differential assembly to remove idler pins, then remove idler pinions ( Figure 18).
Punch mark differential cases for correct location for reassembly. Remove bolts and separate case halves ( Figure 19).

figure.caption: Figure 19. Punch Mark for Correct Location

step1.para: Lift off thrust washer and side gear.
Lift out spider, side pinions and thrust washers. Remove side gear and thrust washer.
Lift off high speed clutch plate by hand. If it cannot be removed easily, press off plate as follows ( Figure 20):

figure.caption: Figure 20. High Speed Clutch Plate Removal

step2.para: Insert properly sized adapters (round metal stock) into two idler pin holes and invert the case assembly in a press. The clutch plate should be down. The adapter length should provide space for removal of the plate.
Use bar stock to block the center hole in the clutch plate and press against it with the press ram.
Continue to press until the plate breaks loose from the plate dowel pins.

step1.para: Remove bearing cones from support cases using a suitable puller.

note.para: Holes are provided in case to enable removal of bearing cone with a pilot punch ( Figure 21). Tap alternately through each hole until cone is removed.

figure.caption: Figure 21. Holes for Removal of Bearing Cone

warning.para: Wear safe eye protection. Do not hit steel parts with a steel hammer. Parts can break and cause injury.
